channel.title: Need good compiler and help....you do not hav JDK 5.0 or 6.0

item.title: Need good compiler and help....you do not hav JDK 5.0 or 6.0
item.dc:creator: @Jeremy368 Jeremy368
item.description:
@Jeremy368 wrote:

[quote=“Jeremy368, post:4, topic:246469”]Download the lastest JDK Here: http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp (Java SE Runtime Environment (JRE) 6 Update 10), Install then you have to set environment variables.
To do this

  1. Right click on my computer
  2. select Properties this should bring up system properties
    3.the click on the advanced tab
    This is what your screen should look like
  3. Click environment variables
  4. In the box labeled “User variables for Owner” click new
  5. for “Variable name” copy and paste this CLASSPATH
  6. for “Variable value” copy and paste this Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_10\bin;%CLASSPATH%;
  7. Then Click “ok” and select new again
  8. for “Variable name” copy and paste this PATH
  9. for “Variable value” copy and past this C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_10\bin;

Let me know if it works!! and i need rep, so rep++ me!![br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 24, 2008, 07:53:36 pm[/size][hr]Opps i forgot the compiler part

  1. open notepad
  2. copy and past this code into notepad @echo off title Rage's Compiler "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java pause
  3. click file
  4. save as
  5. Type “Compiler.bat”
  6. stick it in your sources folder and enjoy![/quote]

dude if u did what i said u should have no problem

Read full topic
item.source: Need good compiler and help....you do not hav JDK 5.0 or 6.0

@jjones10 wrote:

Try this one.

@echo off title Jason's Compiler "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_03\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java echo Succesfully compiled! pause

Notice the jdk version is 1.6.0_03

item.title: Need good compiler and help....you do not hav JDK 5.0 or 6.0
item.dc:creator: @Jeremy368 Jeremy368
item.description:
@Jeremy368 wrote:

Download the lastest JDK Here: http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp (Java SE Runtime Environment (JRE) 6 Update 10), Install then you have to set environment variables.
To do this

  1. Right click on my computer
  2. select Properties this should bring up system properties
    3.the click on the advanced tab
    This is what your screen should look like
  3. Click environment variables
  4. In the box labeled “User variables for Owner” click new
  5. for “Variable name” copy and paste this CLASSPATH
  6. for “Variable value” copy and paste this Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_10\bin;%CLASSPATH%;
  7. Then Click “ok” and select new again
  8. for “Variable name” copy and paste this PATH
  9. for “Variable value” copy and past this C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_10\bin;

Let me know if it works!! and i need rep, so rep++ me!![br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 24, 2008, 07:53:36 pm[/size][hr]Opps i forgot the compiler part

  1. open notepad
  2. copy and past this code into notepad @echo off title Rage's Compiler "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java pause
  3. click file
  4. save as
  5. Type “Compiler.bat”
  6. stick it in your sources folder and enjoy!

Read full topic

@The_Reaper_X wrote:

make sure that you set your environmental variable correctly. and on top of that, make sure that the “jdk1.6.0_10-b33” is the version of jdk you’re using. if not, change it to the right version.

@echo off
title Jason’s Compiler
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_10-b33\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java
pause

please help!!! my e-mail is marrk85@aim.com and my AIM screename is marrk85 thanks!!!
